title: Virgin notes to close early, likely upsized
text:
UBS will close Virgin Australia's listed debt raising earlier than planned and the airline is expected to raise more than its $150 million goal.

Demand for Virgin CEO Paul Scurrah's listed debt raising has been strong. Janie Barrett

The broker will close the book at 4pm on Thursday rather than Friday.

Offer demand was in excess of $325 million, according to a note sent to brokers and institutional investors on Wednesday night.

It is understood the raising is likely to be upsized given demand.

Street Talk understands most of the demand has been from retail brokers. The notes are expected to generate an 8 per cent yearly yield.
description: UBS will close its listed debt raising for Virgin earlier than planned and the airline is expected to raise more than its $150 million goal.
